sentences.sContent: She took early retirement (= retired at an earlier age than usual ) last year.
...Their retirement savings and home values fell sharply at the worst possible time: just before they needed to cash out...
...Those who lose their jobs shortly before retirement age live a shorter-than-average life...
...People who take benefits from Social Security before official retirement age will get much less for the rest of their lives...
...Unlike many Americans compelled into early retirement by company restrictions...

...What Leeson terms "the Warren Buffett effect" is becoming more broadly appealing as individuals come to view retirement as not simply being linked to economic productivity but also about contribution...
...Postponing doing what you love and being with people you love until retirement can be a mistake...
...Why does the company adopt the phased retirement scheme...
